items.name: Ext.layout.component.BoundList
items.text: Component layout for Ext.view.BoundList.

items.name: animatePolicy
items.text: An object that contains as keys the names of the properties that can be animated by child items as a consequence of a layout. This config is used internally by the Ext.layout.container.Accordion layout to cause the child panels to animate to their proper size and position after a collapse/expand event.

items.name: setHeightInDom
items.text:
When publishing height of an auto Component, it is usually not written to the DOM.
Setting this to `true` overrides this behaviour.

items.name: setWidthInDom
items.text:
When publishing width of an auto Component, it is usually not written to the DOM.
Setting this to `true` overrides this behaviour.

items.name: afterCollapse
items.text: Called by an owning Panel after the Panel finishes its collapse process.

items.name: afterExpand
items.text: Called by an owning Panel after the Panel finishes its expand process.

items.name: afterRemove
items.text:
Removes layout's itemCls and owning Container's itemCls.
Clears the managed dimensions flags

items.name: beginLayout
items.text:
Called before any calculation cycles to prepare for layout.

This is a write phase and DOM reads should be strictly avoided when overridding
this method.

items.name: ownerContext
items.text:
The context item for the layout's owner
component.

items.name: beginLayoutCycle
items.text:
Called before any calculation cycles to reset DOM values and prepare for calculation.

This is a write phase and DOM reads should be strictly avoided when overridding
this method.

items.name: ownerContext
items.text:
The context item for the layout's owner
component.

items.name: calculate
items.text: Called to perform the calculations for this layout. This method will be called at least once and may be called repeatedly if the done property is cleared before return to indicate that this layout is not yet done. The done property is always set to `true` before entering this method. This is a read phase and DOM writes should be strictly avoided in derived classes. Instead, DOM writes need to be written to Ext.layout.ContextItem objects to be flushed at the next opportunity.

items.name: ownerContext
items.text:
The context item for the layout's owner
component.

items.name: completeLayout
items.text: This method (if implemented) is called at the end of the cycle in which this layout completes (by not setting done to `false` in calculate). It is possible for the layout to complete and yet become invalid before the end of the cycle, in which case, this method will not be called. It is also possible for this method to be called and then later the layout becomes invalidated. This will result in calculate being called again, followed by another call to this method. This is a read phase and DOM writes should be strictly avoided in derived classes. Instead, DOM writes need to be written to Ext.layout.ContextItem objects to be flushed at the next opportunity. This method need not be implemented by derived classes and, in fact, should only be implemented when needed.

items.name: ownerContext
items.text:
The context item for the layout's owner
component.

items.name: configureItem
items.text: Called before an item is rendered to allow the layout to configure the item.

items.name: item
items.text: The item to be configured

items.name: destroy
items.text:
Destroys this layout. This method removes a `targetCls` from the `target`
element and calls `onDestroy`.

A derived class can override either this method or `onDestroy` but in all
cases must call the base class versions of these methods to allow the base class to
perform its cleanup.

This method (or `onDestroy`) are overridden by subclasses most often to purge
event handlers or remove unmanged DOM nodes.

items.name: finalizeLayout
items.text: This method (if implemented) is called after all layouts have completed. In most ways this is similar to completeLayout. This call can cause this (or any layout) to be become invalid (see Ext.layout.Context#invalidate), but this is best avoided. This method is intended to be where final reads are made and so it is best to avoid invalidating layouts at this point whenever possible. Even so, this method can be used to perform final checks that may require all other layouts to be complete and then invalidate some results. This is a read phase and DOM writes should be strictly avoided in derived classes. Instead, DOM writes need to be written to Ext.layout.ContextItem objects to be flushed at the next opportunity. This method need not be implemented by derived classes and, in fact, should only be implemented when needed.

items.name: ownerContext
items.text:
The context item for the layout's owner
component.

items.name: finishedLayout
items.text:
This method is called after all layouts are complete and their calculations flushed
to the DOM. No further layouts will be run and this method is only called once per
layout run. The base component layout caches `lastComponentSize`.

This is a write phase and DOM reads should be avoided if possible when overridding
this method.

This method need not be implemented by derived classes and, in fact, should only be
implemented when needed.

items.name: ownerContext
items.text:
The context item for the layout's owner
component.

items.name: getItemLayoutEl
items.text:
For a given item, returns the element that participates in the childNodes array
of the layout's target element.  This is usually the component's "el", but can
also be a wrapper

items.name: getItemSizePolicy
items.text:
Returns an object describing how this layout manages the size of the given component.
This method must be implemented by any layout that manages components.

An object describing the sizing done by the layout
for this item.

items.name: getLayoutItems
items.text: Returns the set of items to layout (empty by default).

items.name: getRenderTarget
items.text:
Returns the element into which rendering must take place. Defaults to the owner Component's encapsulating element.

May be overridden in Component layout managers which implement an inner element.

items.name: getTarget
items.text: Returns the owner component's resize element.

items.name: initLayout
items.text: A one-time initialization method called just before rendering.

items.name: isValidParent
items.text: Validates item is in the proper place in the dom.

items.name: moveItem
items.text: Moves Component to the provided target instead.

items.name: notifyOwner
items.text: This method (if implemented) is called after all layouts are finished, and all have a `lastComponentSize` cached. No further layouts will be run and this method is only called once per layout run. It is the bookend to beginLayout. This is a write phase and DOM reads should be avoided if possible when overridding this method. This is the catch-all tail method to a layout and so the rules are more relaxed. Even so, for performance reasons, it is best to avoid reading the DOM. If a read is necessary, consider implementing a finalizeLayout method to do the required reads. This method need not be implemented by derived classes and, in fact, should only be implemented when needed.

items.name: ownerContext
items.text:
The context item for the layout's owner
component.

items.name: onContentChange
items.text: This method is called when a child item changes in some way. By default this calls Ext.Component#updateLayout on this layout's owner.

items.name: child
items.text: The child item that has changed.
True if this layout has handled the content change.

items.name: renderItem
items.text: Renders the given Component into the target Element.

items.name: item
items.text: The Component to render

items.name: target
items.text: The target Element

items.name: position
items.text: The position within the target to render the item to

items.name: renderItems
items.text:
Iterates over all passed items, ensuring they are rendered.  If the items are already rendered,
also determines if the items are in the proper place in the dom.

items.name: setOwner
items.text: Sets the layout owner

items.name: done
items.text: Used only during a layout run, this value indicates that a layout has finished its calculations. This flag is set to true prior to the call to calculate and should be set to false if this layout has more work to do.

items.name: factoryConfig
items.text: If this property is specified by the target class of this mixin its properties are used to configure the created Ext.Factory.

items.name: getScrollerEl
items.text:
Returns the element that wraps the contents for the purposes of touch scrolling.
Only applicable when the layout adds the scroller element as part of its renderTpl
(e.g. autocontainer and box)

items.name: isLayout
items.text: `true` in this class to identify an object as an instantiated Layout, or subclass thereof.

items.name: needsItemSize
items.text: `true` if this layout may need to incorporate the dimensions of individual child items into its layout calculations. Layouts that handle the size of their children as a group (autocontainer, form) can set this to false for an additional performance optimization. When `false` the layout system will not recurse into the child items if Ext.layout.container.Container#activeItemCount is `0`, which will be the case if all child items use "liquid" CSS layout, e.g. form fields. (See Ext.Component#liquidLayout)

items.name: setsItemSize
items.text:
`true` if this layout may set the size of its child items.  Layouts that do not
set the size of their child items (autocontainer, form) can set this to false
for an additional performance optimization.  When `true` the layout system will
not create a context item for children that use liquid layout, because there is
no need for a context item if item size is neither read nor set by the owning layout.
